sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Reverend sirs, Their Majesties having been pleased a second time to hear the cry, and to pity the deplorable case of the poor Protestants of Ireland, by granting another collection for their relief Pilkington, Thomas, Sir, d. 1691.
1 sheet (2 p.)
s.n., [London : 1690]
Title from first 5 lines of text. Signed at end: Thomas Pilkington, Mayor, [and 6 others] Imprint suggested by Wing. "An appeal for church collections for the relief of Irish Protestants"--NUC pre-1956 imprints. Reproduction of original in the Harvard University Library.
=======

s.n., [London : 1690]
